title: What the Bills said about ‘scary situation’ staying in Providence during Brown University shooting
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "Some guys were eating dinner blocks away from where it was going on," quarterback Josh Allen said.
Josh Allen AP Photo/Robert F.
Bukaty FOXBOROUGH — Since Gillette Stadium is relatively close to Providence, some opposing teams opt to stay there when they come to play against the Patriots.

title: 24-year-old from Wisconsin reportedly detained after Brown University shooting
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Benjamin Erickson, 24, was taken into custody at a hotel in Coventry, Rhode Island, according to multiple reports.
Police released surveillance footage of the person of interest sought after the Brown University shooting.

Providence police The person of interest detained in connection to the deadly mass shooting at Brown University Saturday has been identified as a 24-year-old from Wisconsin, according to multiple media reports.

title: ‘Let us play’: Patriots cornerback reacts to controversial fourth-quarter call
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "Just seeing how late the flag came in, I think we're all thinking the same thing.
" Carlton Davis.
AP Photo/Vera Nieuwenhuis FOXBOROUGH – The Patriots were clinging on to a three-point lead with 8:19 to go in the fourth quarter.

title: Stefon Diggs explains why it was ‘good’ for Patriots to lose to Bills on Sunday
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "It’s a lesson for sure that you’re going to have to keep that foot on the gas.
” Stefon Diggs and the Patriots can't dwell on Sunday's loss to Buffalo.
(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: On cusp of an AFC East coronation, Patriots were given cold reality check by Josh Allen
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "That’s why they pay him $60 million.
" Josh Allen and the Bills erased a 21-0 deficit in Foxborough.
(AP Photo/Greg M.

title: Photos: Aftermath of deadly shooting at Brown University
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Local News Police said early Sunday that a person of interest was in custody following a shooting on the campus of Brown University in Providence that killed two people and injured nine.
A person prays outside of Barus & Holley School at Brown University where two people were killed and nine people were injured by a gunman in Providence, Rhode Island December 14, 2025.
Jessica Rinaldi/The Boston Globe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: What Mike Vrabel said about decision to not play Robert Spillane
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots It was a game-time decision, and Spillane (foot) was unable to go on Sunday.
Robert Spillane AP Photo/Gary McCullough FOXBOROUGH – The Patriots were without their leading tackler during Sunday’s 35-31 loss to the Bills.
Linebacker Robert Spillane was present for pregame warmups Gillette Stadium, but wound up sitting out the contest.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled in nail-biter loss to Bills
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots blew a 21 point lead.
Here's the good, the bad, and the ugly.
Matt Milano sacks Drake Maye during the second half of the Patriots' loss against the Bills.

title: Patriots WR Mack Hollins arrives shirtless, barefoot at snowy Gillette Stadium
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "I’m barefoot, but I’m not a dummy.
That’s the saying I like to live by.
” Mack Hollins often goes barefoot when he doesn't wear cleates.

title: 9 takeaways from Patriots’ brutal loss to Bills
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots’ held a 21-0 lead at one point, but couldn’t hold off Josh Allen and the Bills.
Josh Allen and the Bills ran over the Patriots defense in the second half.
(AP Photo/Robert F.
